title: Power of company to arrange for different amounts being paid on shares.
content: 58.- A company, if so authorized by its articles, may do any one or more of the following things- 16 of 70(I) of 2003. (a) accept from any member the whole or a part of the amount remaining unpaid on any shares held by him, although no part of that amount has been called up; 16 of 70(I) of 2003. (b) pay dividend in proportion to the amount paid up on each share where a larger amount is paid up on some shares than on others. Reserve liability of company.
